shorts.title: Lions Club boosts Archbald Santa Train event
shorts.title_distilled: Lions Club boosts Archbald Santa Train event.
shorts.description: The Eynon-Archbald Lions Club was prepared to greet Santa as he arrived in Archbald by “The Santa Train in Christmas in a Small Town” event. The club gave out free hats, gloves and socks to help conquer the cold weather. From left: Lions Shirley Barrett, Madison Potter, Fran Stepkovitch, Maureen Kresge, Cathy Gillette, Paula Turpack, Angie Apostolaros and Erin Owen. (SUBMITTED)
shorts.content: The Eynon-Archbald Lions Club was prepared to greet Santa as he arrived in Archbald by “The Santa Train in Christmas in a Small Town” event. The club gave out free hats, gloves and socks to help conquer the cold weather. From left: Lions Shirley Barrett, Madison Potter, Fran Stepkovitch, Maureen Kresge, Cathy Gillette, Paula Turpack, Angie Apostolaros and Erin Owen. (SUBMITTED)
shorts.content_distilled: Eynon-Archbald Lions Club was prepared to greet Santa as he arrived in Archbald by “The Santa Train in Christmas in a Small Town” event.

shorts.title: Clipboard, December 26, 2025
shorts.description: Regional Test strategies workshop: Johnson College’s WAVE Department hosting two free “Test Strategies That Change the Game” workshops, Jan. 22, 12:30 to 4 p.m. and 5:30 to 9 p.m., Ideal Saldi Hall on the Scranton campus. To register, visit johnson.edu/workshops. The free workshop introduces a focused, proven study system designed to maximize preparation time and significantly boost information retention. Open to individuals 15 and older. PA EMS continuing education is included (3.5 hours, other). Space is limited to 65 participants per workshop. For information, email wave@johnson.edu or call 570-702-8979. Throop Trash collection: Borough trash collection for the week of Dec. […]

shorts.title: THE YEAR IN CRIME: Brutal killings at downtown landmark and ICE arrives
shorts.title_distilled: THE YEAR IN CRIME: Brutal killings at downtown landmark and ICE arrives.
shorts.description: Fatal machete attack at Hotel Jermyn A brutal machete attack at the Hotel Jermyn Apartments in Scranton in early December left two people and a service dog dead and another person with severe injuries. Lackawanna County District Attorney Brian Gallagher identified the deceased victims as Linda P. Fortuna, 61, and Terry M. Muller, 59, a military veteran. Muller’s service dog, Nayla, was also killed in the “pure evil” attack. The third victim, Marilyn Joan Waller, 66, required hospitalization with severe injuries. The accused, Michael Willie Marquis Woods, 38, lived on the same sixth floor of the apartment building as his […]
shorts.content: Fatal machete attack at Hotel Jermyn A brutal machete attack at the Hotel Jermyn Apartments in Scranton in early December left two people and a service dog dead and another person with severe injuries. Lackawanna County District Attorney Brian Gallagher identified the deceased victims as Linda P. Fortuna, 61, and Terry M. Muller, 59, a military veteran. Muller’s service dog, Nayla, was also killed in the “pure evil” attack. The third victim, Marilyn Joan Waller, 66, required hospitalization with severe injuries. The accused, Michael Willie Marquis Woods, 38, lived on the same sixth floor of the apartment building as his […]

shorts.title: HS BASKETBALL: Holiday tournaments fill calendar with action
shorts.title_distilled: HS BASKETBALL: Holiday tournaments fill calendar with action.
shorts.description: Participating and competing in holiday basketball tournaments means a great deal to the players. They embrace the tradition and get excited about the big crowds that fill the host gymnasiums with family and friends. At Old Forge, the Anthony D. “Badger” Marseco Memorial Tournament tugs at their heartstrings, making for an emotional weekend during one of the most celebrated times of the year. For the 17th time, the event will bring together eight teams motivated to take home the title. They play hard in honor of Marseco, a beloved former star athlete at Old Forge High School and former assistant […]
